messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] crossposting question
messages.msgSnippet: My answer: Baa-baa.  I m just a sheeple sometimes, doing what everyone else was doing. ... I m guessing some don t like the duplicates, but IMO, that s the
messages.messageBody:
My answer:

Baa-baa. I'm just a sheeple sometimes, doing what everyone else was doing.
:-)

I'm guessing some don't like the duplicates, but IMO, that's the risk of
subscribing to multiple groups of similar theme.

--Rob

On 9/19/07, Wildflower Car <unschoolfool@...> wrote:
>
>
> I have noticed several people apologize in advance for cross posting to
> several groups. Is this considered bad netiquette? I belong to several
> groups and if I have a question, I post to most or all of them. If I get a
> cross post, I just read the first one and delete the rest.
>
> Any thoughts?
>
> Wildflower
> _________________________________________________________________

> way of saying thanks for using Windows Live�.

messages.subject: crossposting question
messages.msgSnippet: I have noticed several people apologize in advance for cross posting to several groups. Is this considered bad netiquette? I belong to several groups and if I
messages.messageBody:
I have noticed several people apologize in advance for cross posting to several groups. Is this considered bad netiquette? I belong to several groups and if I have a question, I post to most or all of them. If I get a cross post, I just read the first one and delete the rest.

Any thoughts?

Wildflower
